articles.title: Beyond the Doubt
articles.description: Psychology Today - An inside perspective on life with OCD and the lessons of uncertainty.

articles.title: Anxiety Disorders
articles.description: a Pamphlet from the National Institute of Mental Health that outlines the symptoms, research, and treatment of the various Anxiety Disorders: panic disorder, obsessivecompulsive disorder (OCD), posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), social phobia (or social anxiety disorder), specific phobias, and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD)

articles.title: Body Dysmorphic Disorder: A Problem of Perception?
articles.description: by Jamie Fuesner, M.D. from the Winter 2009 OCD Newsletter. This article outlines research into the symptoms and causes of Body Dysmorphic Disorder

articles.title: Body Dysmorphic Disorder: Update on A Spectrum Disorder
articles.description: by Elana Golan, from the Sring 2006 OCD Newsletter. This article updates what is known about BDD, How to determine if someone has BDD, treatment options and relates the personal story of the author's daughter

articles.title: Clearing Clutter to Create Clarity
articles.description: by DeniseLee, Professional Organizer, an article from the Java Journa

articles.title: Clutter, Looking at the Meaning Behind the Mess
articles.description: by Mary Mohler, an article from Ladies Home Journa

articles.title: CY-BOCS
articles.description: The complete Children's Yale-Brown Symptom Checklist and CY-BOCS Serverity Ratings Scale for both Obsessions and Compulsions. This is the test used by professional to evaluate the severity of OCD symptoms. This is a link to Mount Sinai School of Medicine download page to allow you to download the official copy of CY-BOCS. Please scroll to the bottom of the page

articles.title: Deep Brain Stimulation for Highly Treatment-Resistant OCD by Darin Dougherty, M.D. and Benjamin Greenberg, M.D., Ph.D.
articles.description: Discussion of alternative methods of OCD Treatment using both invasive (surgical) and non-invasive (radiation) brain procedures. Particular attention is given to Deep Brain Stimulation and the results to date

articles.title: Deep Brain Stimulation, A New Treatment Shows Promise in the Most Difficult Cases, by Jamie Talan, reviewed by Jamie Feusner, MD.
